attributes.text:
Returns the (computed) value of the property batchSize.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #batchSize}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property pane.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #pane}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property progressive.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #progressive}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property rendererData.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #rendererData}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property userData.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #userData}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property batchSize with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #batchSize}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property model with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property pane with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #pane}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property progressive with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #progressive}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property rendererData with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #rendererData}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property userData with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #userData}.

Resets the user value of the property batchSize.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #batchSize}.

Resets the user value of the property model.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #pane}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #progressive}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #rendererData}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #userData}.

Sets the user value of the property batchSize.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #batchSize}.

Sets the user value of the property userData.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #userData}.
How many elements are rendered at a time, before yielding to the browser. This property should be treated as read-only.
The data model being used. This property should be treated as read-only.
The widget in which the element data should be rendered. This property should be treated as read-only.
The {@link qx.ui.progressive.Progressive} with which this {@link State} is associated. This property should be treated as read-only.

Add a place for renderers’ private data. If multiple renderers are being used, each renderer should place its own private data in the the state object area reserved for that renderer’s use: state.getRendererData()[element.renderer]. This property should be accessed only by renderers, and all elements of the array other than a renderer’s own element should be treated as read-only.

IMPORTANT NOTE: It is the renderer’s responsibility to clean up its own mess. If the renderer places data here, it should also add an event listener for “renderEnd” so that it can clean up.

User data. This is useful, for example, by communication between the renderStart event listener and the renderers.

IMPORTANT NOTE: It is the user’s responsibility to clean up his own mess. If you place data here, you should also add an event listener for “renderEnd” to dispose any objects you placed here.
